intro: Bumelia excisa, commonly known as the Mexican ash, is a deciduous shrub or small tree native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It belongs to the Simaroubaceae family and is characterized by its compound leaves with serrated edges. The plant produces small, yellowish-green flowers in clusters, which are followed by woody, elongated fruits. Bumelia excisa is often found in rocky soils and can thrive in arid or semi-arid environments. Its ecological role includes providing habitat and food for various wildlife species.
